xxl.core.spatial.rectangles
Class RandomRectangle

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor
      xxl.core.spatial.rectangles.RandomRectangle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterator, Cursor
public class RandomRectangle
extends AbstractCursor

A Cursor that returns randomly created Rectangles (of type Rectangle).

Method Detail

hasNextObject

public boolean hasNextObject()
If the needed number of rectangles was not reached yet computes the next rectangle and returns true otherwise returns false

Specified by:
hasNextObject in class AbstractCursor
Returns:
true if next rectangle were created and false if needed number of rectangles was reached already.

nextObject

public Object nextObject()
Returns the next element in the iteration. This element will be accessible by some of the cursor's methods, e.g., update or remove, until a call to next or peek occurs. This is calling next or peek proceeds the iteration and therefore its previous element will not be accessible any more.

This abstract operation should implement the core functionality of the next method which secures that the cursor is in a proper state when this method is called. Due to this the nextObject method need not to deal with exception handling.

Specified by:
nextObject in class AbstractCursor
Returns:
the next element in the iteration.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
Test main method create 1000 random rectangles and print them to standard out

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments - is not used here
